pageContext.description:
The sheet depicts one of 240 portrait minatures commissioned by the aristocrat and humanist Hieronymus Beck von Leopoldsdorf (1525-1596. 
[cda 2017]
It could be a portrait of Magdalena Kopp, daughter of Hans Kopp, who became the second Mrs Leonhard Lackner after 1501 and died in 1555.
[Heinz 1975, 294]
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimension of painted surface: 27.8 x 18.7 cm
Dimensions of support: approx. 50 x 35 cm
[Heinz 1975, 170, 294]
pageContext.inscription:
Inscription on fol. 628: 'des alten Lackners hausfraw'
Beneath the portrait, in pencil: 'Des alten Lackners Hausfrau'
[Heinz 1975, 294]

involvedPersons.suffix: Copy after Lucas Cranach the Elder

metadata.title: Portrait of Magdalena Lackner [from Hieronymus Beck's portrait book, fol 627]

pageContext.provenance:
- after the death of Hieronymus Beck his library and the portrait minatures were transferred to the Court library of Archduke Matthias and probably then bound to create the present codex
- in the 19th century this codex was in Franz Graf Lamberg's library in Pressburg
- before 1900 it entered the Lamberg collection in Ottenstein castle, Lower Austria
- from there it entered a private collection 
- 28.05.1973: auctioned at Hartung und Karl, Munich, No. 131
- acquired by the Kunsthistorische Museum, Vienna[1]

[1] Heinz 1975, 169-170

[Görres, cda 2017]

titles.title: Portrait of Magdalena Lackner [from Hieronymus Beck's portrait book, fol 627]
